definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: Hou mother decided mourning together happy do not bribe, and inspector put gold father.
sentences.chinese: 侯母决定丧事喜事一起办，并买通巡长暂不放金父。

sentences.english: The Scot admitted he bribed a cabbie in Bangkok to let him get behind the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰人承认买通了一个出租司机叫他坐到后座去。

sentences.english: You can buy a man with gold, but only blood and steel will keep him true.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用钱买通，但只有铁血才能让他心服口服。

sentences.english: Somebody paid him to do that, and I'm going to find out who it was.
sentences.chinese: 有人买通他这么做，我要揪出来那人是谁。

sentences.english: The group of stowaway crossed the border by greasing the palms of border guards.
sentences.chinese: 偷渡团伙买通边防警卫，偷渡国境。

sentences.english: Woman , woman , thou are accountable for this.
sentences.chinese: 这个女人是她的心腹，给斯丹恩买通了的。

definition: to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to place in a certain position/to assign to a job/to plant/resettlement (old)
